page.title: 09BONHOMIE HOUSE
page.content:
Bonhomie is a holiday home for the disabled. Mostly old people stay there.It was built in 1967 and Elsie and Doris Walters opened it. Inside the Holiday Centre there is a very happy and friendly atmosphere.Each night they have entertainment. In the building there are lifts for the disabled to get from one floor to the other.
In each bedroom there is a hand basin and next to the beds there are special buttons for people who need help in the night. In each corridor there is a bathroom. In the bathroom there is special equipment for the disabled. This contains shower chairs and bath hoists. There are plenty of nurses to help the disabled in need.
